article.headline: Drexel 91, William & Mary 65
article.story: PHILADELPHIA (AP) -- Phil Goss came off the bench and scored 21 points, including five 3-pointers, to lead Drexel to a 91-65 win over William and Mary on Saturday. The Dragons (3-2 Colonial Athletic Association, 7-6) shot 72 percent from 3-point range in the first half, hitting 13 out of 18 attempts to win their third straight game. Goss, who did not start because of an illness, was 5-of-7 from 3-point range in the first half. Drexel finished with 15 3-point field goals, one short of the team record set back in 2002. The 91-point total was a season-best for the Dragons. Dominick Mejia scored all 11 of his points for the Dragons in the first half. His 3-point field goal with 7:53 remaining in the first half capped off a 16-4 run that gave Drexel a 33-19 lead. William and Mary (0-5 Colonial Athletic Association, 4-10) trailed by as many as 31 points in the second half as they lost their fifth straight game. Corey Cofield came off the bench to lead the Tribe with 20 points. Danny Hinds added 15 points for the Dragons.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
